title: Getting-started
text: data recorded weather station contributed Facundo Ramón Ispizua Yamati sugarbeet field trial. format data model functions can recognise data won’t return errors due inconsistencies NAs common weather data. require user think replace NAs state default values complete dataset. can find epidemic start date calling calc_epidemic_onset() function. function wrapper calc_DIV() function calculates daily infection values , Wolf Racca methods. date determined negative prognosis models last day epidemic likely start. calc_DIV() days weather data frame provided, starting first day, integrating hourly data.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: cercospoRa mechanistic epidemiological model estimating epidemics Cercospora beticola sugar beat farms, available R package.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: package imports epiphytoolR. install package run following code R. Next install package

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: weathr data.table containing weather data recorded sugarbeat field trial observing spread severity C. beticola.
code: library(epiphytoolR) library(cercospoRa)  # Inspect raw weather station data head(cercospoRa::weathr) # make a copy of the data wthr <- data.table(weathr)  # Format times to POSIXct time with UTC timezone wthr[,Time := as.POSIXct(paste0(Datum, " ",Stunde,":00"),tz = "UTC")]  # Nominate Latitude and Longitude location of the weather station.  # While not needed in cercospoRa some plant disease models will use location to  #  decide the closest weather station to pull weather from wthr[, c("lon","lat") := list(9.916,51.41866)]  # weather is hourly and will error if we don't specify a standard deviation of  #  weather direction. This is intentional to force the user to decide how variable #  the wind direction data could be. wthr[, wd_std := 20]  # remove all data after September as it contains missing data wthr <- wthr[Datum < as.POSIXct("2022-10-01")]  # set NA wind speed values to zero wthr[is.na(WG200),WG200 := 0]  # set NA wind direction values to 20 degrees. Wind is not important for this model wthr[is.na(WR200),WR200 := 20]  # format_weather() is a function from epiphytoolR that formats weather data to  #  hourly and checks for missing data or any issues that may cause downstream faults #  in the model. wthr <-    epiphytoolR::format_weather(wthr,                               POSIXct_time = "Time",                               time_zone = "UTC",                               temp = "T200",                               rain = "N100",                               rh = "F200",                               wd = "WR200",                               ws = "WG200",                               station = "Station",                               lon = "lon",                               lat = "lat",                               wd_sd = "wd_std",                               data_check = FALSE # this stops the function from checking for faults                          )

what: Calculate the proportional progress towards an epidemic
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: returns POSIXct date onset epidemic susceptible resistant cultivar. input weather data provide window epidemic onset date met, proportional progress towards epidemic returned. calc_epidemic_onset() wrapper calc_DIV() returns data.table detailing daily contribution towards “daily infection values” (Wolf Verreet, 2005). detailed output daily infection values call calc_DIV()
code: # susceptible cultivar calc_epidemic_onset(c_closure = as.POSIXct("2022-07-01"),                     weather = wthr,                     cultivar_sus = 3) # resistant cultivar                     calc_epidemic_onset(c_closure = as.POSIXct("2022-07-01"),                     weather = wthr,                     cultivar_sus = 5)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: produces data.table detailing daily infection value day using method described Wolf Verreet (2005). Note: Missing humidity values prevent model running days assumed progress model. Racca Jörg model returns NA values Wolf model returns 0 seen calc_DIV(dat = bris_formated) function output.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: main branch production branch provides functions recreate model described Wolf Verreet (2005) explained paper. main branch locked, please contribute dev branch. dev (development) branch also includes functions recreate C. beticola mechanistic models published Racca Jörg (2007) auxilary functions might helpful future versions.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Wolf, P. F., & Verreet, J. . (2005). Factors Affecting Onset Cercospora Leaf Spot Epidemics Sugar Beet Establishment Disease-Monitoring Thresholds. Phytopathology, 95(3), 269-274. Racca, P., Jörg, E. (2007). CERCBET 3 – forecaster epidemic development Cercospora beticola. EPPO Bulletin, 37(2), 344-349.

title: Calculate daily infection values — calc_DIV
text: function calculates daily infection values Cercospora berticola sugar beet. Functions adapted (Wolf Verreet 2005)  (Wolf et al. 2001)

title: Calculate daily infection values — calc_DIV
text: date_time POSIX_ct, date time weather recording taken Tm numeric, temperature, celcius' time increment date_time RH numeric, relative humidity (%) time increment date_time rain numeric, volume rain millimeters recorded time recordings dat data.frame, containing column names "times","temp","rh","rain" respective arguments input. provided convenience

title: Calculate daily infection values — calc_DIV
text: data.table, probability infection day, 0 1 Undertaken two methods Wolf (Wolf Verreet 2005) DIV column method Racca et. al (Racca Jörg 2007) described DIV_racca column.

title: Calculate daily infection values — calc_DIV
text: Racca P, Jörg E (2007). “CERCBET 3 – forecaster epidemic development Cercospora beticola*.” EPPO Bulletin, 37(2), 344--349. ISSN 1365-2338, doi:10.1111/j.1365-2338.2007.01136.x , _  eprint: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/pdf/10.1111/j.1365-2338.2007.01136.x, https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/j.1365-2338.2007.01136.x. Wolf PFJ, Heindl M, Verreet JA (2001). “Zum Einfluss des Bestandesklimas auf die Prädisposition der Zuckerrübe gegenüber Infektionen von Cercospora beticola (Sacc.) / Influence sugar beet leaf mass development predisposition crop Cercospora beticola (Sacc.).” Zeitschrift für Pflanzenkrankheiten und Pflanzenschutz / Journal Plant Diseases Protection, 108(6), 578--592. ISSN 0340-8159, Publisher: Verlag Eugen Ulmer KG, https://www.jstor.org/stable/43215404. Wolf PFJ, Verreet JA (2005). “Factors Affecting Onset Cercospora Leaf Spot Epidemics Sugar Beet Establishment Disease-Monitoring Thresholds.” Phytopathology®, 95(3), 269--274. ISSN 0031-949X, doi:10.1094/PHYTO-95-0269 , Publisher: Scientific Societies, https://apsjournals.apsnet.org/doi/abs/10.1094/PHYTO-95-0269.

title: Calculate daily infection values — calc_DIV
code: date_t <- Sys.time() + seq(0, 179 * 60 * 10, (60 * 10)) Tm <- rnorm(180,20,10) RH <- runif(180,min = 40,90) rain <- rbinom(180,1,0.1) * runif(180,0.1,20)  DIV1 <- calc_DIV( date_time = date_t, Tm = Tm, RH = RH, rain = rain )

title: Calculate epidemic onset — calc_epidemic_onset
text: Calculate epidemic onset

title: Calculate epidemic onset — calc_epidemic_onset
text: start posixct, start date begin calculating epidemic onset, specified, first date weather data used. end posixct, end date, last date complete calculating epidemic onset, specified, last date weather data used. c_closure POSIXct formatted date start model running model usually canopy closure (Wolf) weather data.table, formatted epiphytoolR::format_weather cultivar_sus character, susceptibility cultivar "R" resistant, "S" susceptible, "MR" moderately resistant ect.

title: Calculate epidemic onset — calc_epidemic_onset
text: $wolf_date: input weather conducive epidemic, function returns POSIX_ct date epidemic commences. epidemic occurs, numeric, proportion indicating progress epidemic returned racca_percent: input weather conducive epidemic, function returns POSIX_ct date epidemic commences. epidemic occurs, numeric, proportion indicating progress epidemic returned

title: Calculate epidemic onset — calc_epidemic_onset
code: wethr <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "clean_weather.csv",                   package = "cercospoRa")) wethr <- epiphytoolR::format_weather(wethr,time_zone = "UTC")  calc_epidemic_onset(start = as.POSIXct("2022-04-25",tz = "UTC"),                     end = as.POSIXct("2022-09-30",tz = "UTC"),                     c_closure = as.POSIXct("2022-07-01",tz = "UTC"),                     weather = wethr) #> $wolf_date #> [1] "2022-08-14 UTC" #>  #> $racca_date #> [1] "2022-07-31 UTC" #>

title: Calculate Cercospora latent period — latent_period
text: Calculate Cercospora latent period

title: Calculate Cercospora latent period — latent_period
text: Tm numeric, Average temperature degrees Celsius hour day ref character, method calculating latent period. Default "wolf" also available "jarroudi". See references formulas used

title: Calculate Cercospora latent period — latent_period
text: numeric, Latent period given hour. ref = "jarroudi" returns latent period days.

title: Calculate Cercospora latent period — latent_period
text: Calculates latent period Cercospora beticola infections sugar beet

title: Calculate Cercospora latent period — latent_period
text: Wolf PFJ, Verreet JA (2005). “Factors Affecting Onset Cercospora Leaf Spot Epidemics Sugar Beet Establishment Disease-Monitoring Thresholds.” Phytopathology®, 95(3), 269--274. ISSN 0031-949X, doi:10.1094/PHYTO-95-0269 , Publisher: Scientific Societies, https://apsjournals.apsnet.org/doi/abs/10.1094/PHYTO-95-0269. ; equation 4 El Jarroudi M, Chairi F, Kouadio L, Antoons K, Sallah , Fettweis X (2021). “Weather-Based Predictive Modeling Cercospora beticola Infection Events Sugar Beet Belgium.” Journal Fungi, 7(9), 777. ISSN 2309-608X, doi:10.3390/jof7090777 , https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8470031/. ; equation 1

title: Get temperature index — temperature_index
text: Temperature index proportional representation latent period. Temperatures optimum temperature disease cycle yield 1 lower temperature infinitely longer latent period.

title: Get temperature index — temperature_index
text: Tm numeric, temperature given hour opt_Tm numeric, lowest temperature optimum temperatures (fastest) latent period.

title: Get temperature index — temperature_index
text: numeric, proportion representing speed latent period relation temperature optimum
